template.name: HP iLO by SNMP
template.description:
Template Server HP iLO
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB CPQHLTH-MIB SNMPv2-MIB CPQSINFO-MIB CPQIDA-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.41

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/HP iLO by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/HP iLO by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/HP iLO by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/HP iLO by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: System: Temperature status
item.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB This value specifies the overall condition of the system's thermal environment. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The machine product name.The name of the machine used in this system.

item.name: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The serial number of the physical system unit. The string will be empty if the system does not report the serial number function.

trigger.expression: last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#2) and length(last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Overall system health status
item.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The overall condition. This object represents the overall status of the server information represented by this MIB.

trigger.name: System status is in critical state
trigger.description: Please check the device for errors

trigger.name: System status is in warning state
trigger.description: Please check the device for warnings

dependency.name: System status is in critical state

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: Array Controller Cache Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaAccelTable

item_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Cache Module Board Backup Power Status. This monitors the status of each backup power source on the board. The backup power source can only recharge when the system has power applied. The type of backup power source used is indicated by cpqDaAccelBackupPowerSource. The following values are valid: Other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize backup power status. You may need to update your software.
Ok (2) The backup power source is fully charged.
Recharging (3) The array controller has one or more cache module backup power sources that are recharging. Cache module operations such as Battery/Flash Backed Write Cache, Expansion, Extension and Migration are temporarily suspended until the backup power source is fully charged. Cache module operations will automatically resume when charging is complete.
Failed (4) The battery pack is below the sufficient voltage level and has not recharged in 36 hours. Your Cache Module board needs to be serviced.
Degraded (5) The battery is still operating, however, one of the batteries in the pack has failed to recharge properly. Your Cache Module board should be serviced as soon as possible.
NotPresent (6) A backup power source is not present on the cache module board. Some controllers do not have backup power sources.
Capacitor Failed (7) The flash backed cache module capacitor is below the sufficient voltage level and has not recharged in 10 minutes. Your Cache Module board needs to be serviced.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:\"failed\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:\"capacitorFailed\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery is in critical state!
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery is in critical state!
dependency.expression: count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:\"failed\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:\"capacitorFailed\"}")=1

item_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Cache Module/Operations Status. This describes the status of the cache module and/or cache operations. Note that for some controller models, a cache module board that physically attaches to the controller or chipset may not be an available option.
The status can be: Other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize the status of the cache module. You may need to upgrade the instrument agent.
Invalid (2) Indicates that a cache module board has not been installed in this system or is present but not configured.
Enabled (3) Indicates that cache operations are currently configured and enabled for at least one logical drive.
Temporarily Disabled (4) Indicates that cache operations have been temporarily disabled. View the cache module board error code object to determine why the write cache operations have been temporarily disabled.
Permanently Disabled (5) Indicates that cache operations have been permanently disabled. View the cache module board error code object to determine why the write cache operations have been disabled.
Cache Module Flash Memory Not Attached (6) Indicates that the flash memory component of the flash backed cache module is not attached. This status will be set when the flash memory is not attached and the Supercap is attached. This value is only used on flash backed cache modules that support removable flash memory.
Cache Module Degraded Failsafe Speed (7) Indicates that the cache module board is currently degraded and operating at a failsafe speed. View variables cpqDaCacheMemoryDataWidth and cpqDaCacheMemoryTransferRate to obtain the cache module board`s current memory data width and memory transfer rate.
Cache Module Critical Failure (8) Indicates that the cache module board has encountered a critical failure. The controller is currently operating in Zero Memory Raid mode.
Read Cache Could Not Be Mapped (9) Indicates that the read cache memory in a split cache configuration could not be mapped by the operating system and as a result is not available. This status may be caused by virtual space limitations in certain operating systems and is only applicable to B-Series controllers.

trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in critical state!
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:\"cacheModDegradedFailsafeSpeed\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:\"cacheReadCacheNotMapped\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:\"cacheModFlashMemNotAttached\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in critical state!

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"ne","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_OK_STATUS:\"enabled\"}")=1 and last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"invalid"}
trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is not in optimal state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in critical state!
#{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in warning state
dependency.expression: count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:\"cacheModDegradedFailsafeSpeed\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:\"cacheReadCacheNotMapped\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:\"cacheModFlashMemNotAttached\"}")=1

discovery_rule.name: Array Controller Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaCntlrTable

item_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller model
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Array Controller Model. The type of controller card.

item_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB This value represents the overall condition of this controller, and any associated logical drives,physical drives, and array accelerators.

trigger_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state

item_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The condition of the fan. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Fan status detection is not supported by this system or driver. ok(2) The fan is operating properly. degraded(2) A redundant fan is not operating properly. failed(4) A non-redundant fan is not operating properly.

trigger_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the fan unit

trigger_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the fan unit

dependency.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Physical Disk Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of physical drive entries CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaPhyDrvTable.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk media type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Drive Array Physical Drive Media Type.The following values are defined: other(1) The instrument agent is unable to determine the physical drive's media type. rotatingPlatters(2) The physical drive media is composed of rotating platters. solidState(3) The physical drive media is composed of solid state electronics.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Model.This is a text description of the physical drive. The text that appears depends upon who manufactured the drive and the drive type. If a drive fails, note the model to identify the type of drive necessary for replacement. If a model number is not present, you may not have properly initialized the drive array to which the physical drive is attached for monitoring.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Serial Number. This is the serial number assigned to the physical drive. This value is based upon the serial number as returned by the SCSI inquiry command but may have been modified due to space limitations. This can be used for identification purposes.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Disk serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk size
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Size in MB. This is the size of the physical drive in megabytes. This value is calculated using the value 1,048,576 (2^20) as a megabyte. Drive manufacturers sometimes use the number 1,000,000 as a megabyte when giving drive capacities so this value may differ from the advertised size of a drive. This field is only applicable for controllers which support SCSI drives, and therefore is not supported by the IDA or IDA-2 controllers. The field will contain 0xFFFFFFFF if the drive capacity cannot be calculated or if the controller does not support SCSI drives.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk S.M.A.R.T. status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive S.M.A.R.T Status.The following values are defined: other(1) The agent is unable to determine if the status of S.M.A.R.T predictive failure monitoring for this drive. ok(2) Indicates the drive is functioning properly. replaceDrive(3) Indicates that the drive has a S.M.A.R.T predictive failure error and should be replaced.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[cpqDaPhyDrvSmartStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_SMART_FAIL_STATUS:\"replaceDrive\"}")=1 or count(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[cpqDaPhyDrvSmartStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$DISK_SMART_FAIL_STATUS:\"replaceDriveSSDWearOut\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk S.M.A.R.T. failed
trigger_prototype.description: Disk probably requires replacement.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Status. This shows the status of the physical drive. The following values are valid for the physical drive status: other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize the drive. You may need to upgrade your instrument agent and/or driver software. ok (2) Indicates the drive is functioning properly. failed (3) Indicates that the drive is no longer operating and should be replaced. predictiveFailure(4) Indicates that the drive has a predictive failure error and should be replaced.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

item_prototype.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The condition of the power supply. This value will be one of the following: other(1) The status could not be determined or not present. ok(2) The power supply is operating normally. degraded(3) A temperature sensor, fan or other power supply component is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) A power supply component detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

dependency.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature sensor condition
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The Temperature sensor condition. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system. The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent. If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature could not be determined
trigger_prototype.description: Temperature could not be determined.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.
trigger_prototype.description: The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range
trigger_prototype.description: If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature sensor location
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB This specifies the location of the temperature sensor present in the system.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: {#SNMPINDEX}

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery Ambient
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with ambient(11) and 0.1 index filter

item_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature sensor condition
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The Temperature sensor condition. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system. The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent. If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

trigger_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature could not be determined
trigger_prototype.description: Temperature could not be determined.

trigger_prototype.name: Ambient: The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.
trigger_prototype.description: The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent.

trigger_prototype.name: Ambient: The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range
trigger_prototype.description: If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

item_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: Ambient

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery CPU
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with cpu(6) filter

The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent. If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

trigger_prototype.name: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}: The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.
trigger_prototype.description: The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent.

trigger_prototype.description: If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

item_prototype.name: I/O-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature sensor condition

This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system. The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent. If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

trigger_prototype.description: If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: I/O-{#SNMPINDEX}

discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with memory(7) filter

This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system. The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent. discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with powerSupply(10) filter

item_prototype.name: PSU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature sensor condition
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The Temperature sensor condition. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system. trigger_prototype.description: If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: PSU-{#SNMPINDEX}

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery System
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with system(3) filter

item_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature sensor condition
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The Temperature sensor condition. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system. The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent. If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

trigger_prototype.description: Temperature could not be determined.

trigger_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.
trigger_prototype.description: The system will automatically shutdown if the failed(4) condition results, so it is unlikely that this value will ever be returned by the agent.

trigger_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range
trigger_prototype.description: If the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction is set to shutdown(3) the system will be shutdown if the degraded(3) condition occurs.

item_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: System-{#SNMPINDEX}

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Layout type
item_prototype.description: Logical Drive Fault Tolerance. This shows the fault tolerance mode of the logical drive.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Disk size
item_prototype.description: Logical Drive Size. This is the size of the logical drive in megabytes. This value is calculated using the value 1,048,576 (2^20) as a megabyte. Drive manufacturers sometimes use the number 1,000,000 as a megabyte when giving drive capacities so this value may differ from the advertised size of a drive.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Status
item_prototype.description: Logical Drive Status.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Virtual disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: Please check virtual disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Virtual disk is not in OK state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check virtual disk for warnings or errors

trigger.expression: (last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/HP iLO by SNMP/system.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Host has been restarted
